channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024050627
item.description:
Report X-2024050627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unprocessed hazmat shipped as LQ. Inner containers are drums of UN3378. One drum holds 10lb, the other drum holds 8lb. The 10lb drum cracked near top rim. Due to the product's packing group, the container sizes exceed the amount permitted for Limited Quantity.

item.title: Report E-2024050253
item.description:
Report E-2024050253

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1805 was punctured and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. EXE patched and plugged the damaged tote and deployed absorbents. The crew wiped the impacted surfaces with absorbent pads. All impacted waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
